intro: Elaphoglossum atropunctatum, commonly known as the black-punctured holly fern, is a species of fern native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Dryopteridaceae and is characterized by its finely divided, lance-shaped fronds. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and rocky slopes. Its spores are produced in sori that are clustered on the underside of the fronds. Elaphoglossum atropunctatum is noted for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in shaded gardens.
